intro: Cymbopogon liangshanensis, commonly known as the Liangshan citron grass, is a perennial grass native to China. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its slender,丛生 (clumped) growth habit. The plant produces narrow, blade-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its unique chemical composition, it has potential applications in traditional medicine and aromatherapy.
